intro: Philadelphus robustus, commonly known as the robust mock orange, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and can grow up to 6 meters tall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Philadelphus robustus is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
